cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles E of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest just north of Cuba, forecast to turn northwest toward the Florida Keys and south-central Florida this weekend, then track north-northwest across the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Panhandle and inland into Alabama/Georgia early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near the Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch for the Cuban provinces of Ciego de Avila, Camaguey, Las Tunas, Holguin, and Granma, and for the Florida Keys from Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and the southwest Florida coast from Bonita Beach to Ocean Reef including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and south Florida this weekend, Florida Panhandle and northern Gulf Coast Sunday-Monday, with heavy-rain impacts spreading into the Southeast U.S. (including Georgia/Carolinas) early next week
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8% chance) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible Monday night-Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast based on current track
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals early next week, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes/waterspouts in rainbands; lightning and temporary visibility reductions affecting port operations
